alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 6:37AM PST until December 29 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 3000 feet, with accumulations of up to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The high terrain along the western portion of the Shasta Valley above 3000 feet. This includes a small portion of I- 5 near Hilt. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snowfall at I-5 near Hilt is forecast to be much lighter than other areas in the advisory. In this area forecast amounts are between 3 to 4 inches, heaviest Thursday morning before 10 AM. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
